Dingjia (Brian) Lin (He/Him) is a Research Associate at King’s College London, UK, focusing on cell-free massive MIMO, mobile edge computing (MEC), and convex and non-convex optimization.

He holds a PhD in Electrical and Electronic Engineering from the University of Manchester, UK. Additionally, he earned two Master’s degrees — one in Mobile Communication and Smart Networking from the University of Southampton, UK, and another in Electronic and Electrical Engineering from the University of Sheffield, UK — as well as a Bachelor’s degree in Communication Engineering from Chongqing University of Posts and Telecommunications, P. R. China.

He has published extensively on topics such as energy efficiency maximization, beamforming, and uplink optimization in advanced communication systems. He is proficient in Python, MATLAB, and LaTeX, fluent in both English and Mandarin Chinese, and enjoys photography, reading, and astronomical observation.
